value.title: 7 Tremendous Changes Artificial Intelligence Brings to the Education Sector
value.excerpt: Have you considered the role of AI in education as more academic institutes discover its virtues in the coming years?

value.title: Andy Jassy’s AWS keynote revealed little about multicloud plans
value.excerpt: In a market moving increasingly toward multi and hybrid cloud models, people are eager to see how AWS’s attitude will evolve.

value.title: How Watson Assistant helped UAMS answer the public’s health questions
value.excerpt: The University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) is the state’s only health sciences university. Located in Little Rock, Arkansas, its mission is to improve the health, health care and well-being of Arkansans and of others in the region, nation and the world. value.title: AWS announces Panorama a device adds machine learning technology to any camera
value.excerpt: AWS has launched a new hardware device, the AWS Panorama Appliance, which, alongside the AWS Panorama SDK, will transform existing on-premises cameras into computer vision enabled super-powered surveillance devices.

value.title: 7 Machine Learning Stocks for a Smarter Future
value.excerpt: Machine learning is a subset of AI (Artificial Intelligence). It’s about using sophisticated algorithms to find patterns in large amounts of data. Note that machine learning is far from new.

value.title: AI still struggles to recognize hateful memes, but it’s slowly improving
value.excerpt: The preliminary results of Facebook's Hateful Memes Challenge suggest that multimodal tasks pose a challenge for AI.

value.title: WaveOne aims to make video AI-native and turn streaming upside down
value.excerpt: Video has worked the same way for a long, long time. And because of its unique qualities, video has been largely immune to the machine learning explosion upending industry after industry. value.title: As Algorithms Take Over More of the Economy, We Should Cede Control (Very) Carefully
value.excerpt: As they proliferate, experts say, we need to make sure they don’t collude against us in damaging ways. Fears of malevolent artificial intelligence plotting humanity’s downfall are a staple of science fiction. But there are plenty of nearer-term ...

value.title: AI, 5G, and IoT top the list of the most important technologies for 2021
value.excerpt: CIOs and CTOs say the biggest challenge next year will be dealing with recovery from COVID-19, according to a new study by the IEEE.

value.title: Amazon debuts Trainium, a custom chip for machine learning training in the cloud
value.excerpt: Amazon unveiled Trainium, a custom chip for machine learning training workloads. It'll be available to AWS customers in H2 2021.

value.title: AWS adds natural language search service for business intelligence from its data sets
value.excerpt: When Amazon Web Services launched QuickSight, its business intelligence service, back in 2016, the company wanted to provide product information and customer information for business users — not just developers.

value.title: Finnish researchers say AI tool can help optimize cancer combination therapy
value.excerpt: Researchers in Finland have developed a machine-learning tool that accurately predicts how different cancer drugs kill disease cells, according to a paper published Tuesday by Nature Communications.

value.title: Healthcare Artificial Intelligence Requires Data Access, Standards
value.excerpt: To ensure the successful use of artificial intelligence in healthcare, leaders will need to expand data access and develop industry standards.

value.title: DeepMind AI breakthrough in protein folding will accelerate medical discoveries
value.excerpt: Machine learning enables AlphaFold system to determine protein structures in days -- as accurate as experimental results that take months or years.

value.title: Translation Is Trickier For Business, And Artificial Intelligence Can Help

value.excerpt: The post ‘All hands on deck’: How Duke University and AI for Health raced to create a COVID-19 solution for patients appeared first on The AI Blog.

value.title: Amazon debuts Trainium, a custom chip for machine learning training
value.excerpt: Amazon unveiled Trainium, a custom chip for machine learning training workloads. It'll be available to AWS customers in H2 2021.

value.title: How AI Can Help To Moderate Content
value.excerpt: Social Media companies such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc., have been using a combination of human content moderators and technology to try to limit the amount of harmful content.

value.title: Snapdragon 888 unveiled with massive upgrades to GPU, AI hardware and 5G modem
value.excerpt: Qualcomm teases "most significant upgrade" to the Adreno GPU, holds back details for now. The CPU is kept under wraps too.

value.title: Soldiers Don’t Trust Robot Battle Buddies. Can Virtual Training Fix That?
value.excerpt: Allowing soldiers to train their robot wingmen in game environments could be the key to human-machine teaming.

value.title: Tiger Global-Backed Hospital Software Maker Olive AI Reaches $1.5 Billion Value
value.excerpt: An Ohio startup that helps hospitals automate routine tasks is now valued at $1.5 billion after a funding round led by Tiger Global Management.

value.title: Google Releases Objectron Dataset for 3D Object Recognition AI
value.excerpt: Google Research announced the release of Objectron, a machine-learning dataset for 3D object recognition. The dataset contains 15k video segments and 4M images with ground-truth annotations, along with tools for using the data to train AI models.

value.title: A.I. start-up Scale now worth more than $3.5 billion and breaking even
value.excerpt: Scale cleans up data so companies can build good artificial intelligence models. It's been trying hard to keep up with fast-growing customer DoorDash this year.

value.title: ServiceNow (NOW) Set to Acquire AI-Focused Startup Element AI
value.excerpt: ServiceNow, Inc NOW recently announced that it will be acquiring Canada-based Artificial Intelligence (AI) focused start up, Element AI. Element AI acquisition will assist ServiceNow to create an intelligent workflow platform to streamline decision-making for businesses and bolster employee productivity,
